content:
That's a great idea! The New Yorker is known for its in-depth feature articles, and their website has a wealth of content that's worth exploring. You can find reviews and recommendations for documentaries, films, and TV shows, as well as articles on culture, politics, and technology.

If you're looking for more documentary recommendations, you can check out The New Yorker's "Culture" section, which often features reviews and essays on documentaries, films, and TV shows. They also have a "What to Watch" section that highlights new and notable releases.

Additionally, you can follow The New Yorker's critics and writers on social media, such as Alexandra Schwartz, Jia Tolentino, and Emily Nussbaum, who often share their recommendations and reviews of documentaries, films, and TV shows.

By exploring The New Yorker's online content, you may discover new documentaries, films, or TV shows that align with your interests and values. You can then share these recommendations with your friends and continue to explore and learn together.

Remember, the more we learn and discuss these important topics, the more we can inspire each other to take action and make a positive impact on the world.

Enjoy your exploration of The New Yorker's online content, and happy watching!
